item.title: apache directory uid search
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: LDAP user query using Apache Directory

Revision History:
    2015-06-01 11:53:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)
- This applies to HHS Environment. This KB can be retired if/when we move to jenkins auto deploy.

Links:
     http://directory.apache.org/studio/downloads.html


Prerequisites
You are on HHS VPN.
You have an established connection to the LDAP server in Apache Directory.
You know the uid to be searched.

- In the left pane (LDAP Browser), expand the directory tree until you get to ou=people.
- Right click on this and select Quick Search.
- Change the filter from the following: 
(objectclass=*)
to
(uid=<THE UID YOU’RE SEARCHING FOR>)
Example:
(uid=deploy)
- Click Search.



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: Apache exceptions to Tomcat
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Redirecting specific files from Apache instead of primary Tomcat destination

Revision History:
    2017-02-13 14:30:00 - Version 1 created by Andrew O’Dell

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


Specific example: CS-3847. Although syndication content was served by tomcat through apache, we wanted apache to (temporarily) serve a file: 
“Could you also make the Akamai test object (attached) available  on the Syndication API ELB as follows:https://api.digitalmedia.hhs.gov/akamai-test-object.html?  This is for SureRoute, a feature that enables Akamai to take a more optimal path to your origin web servers instead of just the given BGP path.  Akamai makes periodic requests for this test object to determine the best path to use for dynamic content for future requests.”



The apache vhost file redirected all content to tomcat through the mod_jk, via:

    JkMount /* api

Solution:

1) Add a document root with the file we wanted to make available, with all permissions granted:

    DocumentRoot /appdata/www/syndication
    <Directory "/appdata/www/syndication">
       Require all granted
   </Directory>


2) add an exception for the specific file that we wanted apache to serve:

    JkUnMount /akamai-test-object.html api


Note: We also chown’d the file to www-data:www-data; not sure if this was required or not.


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: Apache rewriterule
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Apache rewrite rule

Revision History:
    2015-09-02 00:32:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Apache rewrite rule 

- enable mod rewrite
a2enmod rewrite
- reload apache
service apache2 reload
- edit your apache virtual host and add the following lines, substituting old/new as necessary:
        Rewriteengine On
        RewriteRule old/(.*)$ /new/$1 [R,L]
- reload apache
service apache2 reload
- Optional
make case intensive with [NC]


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: querying apache servers for vhosts
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Syncing CTAC-SysAdmin Vault for 1Password.

Revision History:
    2015-02-04 15:20:19 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

1) Be sure to have Google Drive installed.   https://www.google.com/drive/download/
2) After installing:  Be sure to let you Google Drive sync.. this should sync to ~/Google Drive.
3) After it is sync’d, navigate to ~/Google Drive/sysadmin_library/vault and right-click > open with 1Password XXXX  .. If you have the commercial and Beta installed you may have several versions listed.. select the latest.  You will need to enter the vault password.  This is different from your primary vault password.

You should be good to go.

THIS VAULT IS SHARED.  Only store credentials and information that is for the team.  DO NOT DELETE, MOVE or otherwise damage this file.   

If you use the 1Password for iOS.. (and possibly android) .. it only allows one sync service (dropbox).  There are some options.. if you store vaults in Google Drive or elsewhere.

1) WiFi syncing..
2) Use MacDropAny.app [or manually]  (http://www.zibity.com/macdropany.html) which quickly creates a symlink between your Dropbox 1Password folder and  your folder (e.g. lrwxr-xr-x   1 prigor  staff    50 Jan 16 13:52 ctac-sysadmin-vault -> /Users/prigor/Google Drive/sysadmin_library/vault/)
   — Note you will need a dropbox account.  Which you probably have since the Syndication team mainly uses dropbox for sharing.



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```
